summary: The Army Corps operates and maintains over 700 dams, including the Harlan County Dam in Nebraska. The Corps recently repaired this dam's "Tainter gates"—which control water flow over the dam—to correct a design deficiency. Irrigators that draw water from the dam are responsible for paying for part of the $30 million repair. These repairs mark the Corps' first application of a formerly-unused provision in law...
title: Dam Safety: Army Corps' Decisions about and Status of Repayment for Harlan County Dam Repairs
